reg:regulation.reg:title:
Trust and Deposit Business
Exemption Regulation

bcl:definition.bcl:text: Act means the Financial Institutions Act;
disability assistance has the same meaning as in the Employment and Assistance for Persons with Disabilities Act;
income assistance has the same meaning as in the Employment and Assistance Act;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: to or for whom income assistance is provided under the Employment and Assistance Act, or
to or for whom disability assistance is provided under the Employment and Assistance for Persons with Disabilities Act.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Subject to the conditions set out in section 3, the Coast Foundation Society (1974) and The Bloom Group Community Services Society are exempt from section 70 [unauthorized trust business by corporation prohibited] of the Act.
In order to qualify for an exemption under section 2

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the society must maintain the following insurance for its officers, directors and employees engaged in the society's trust business:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: fidelity insurance, providing coverage in an amount not less than the amount determined by multiplying the total value of the assets held in trust by the society by 0.5%;
errors and omissions insurance, providing coverage in an amount not less than $1 million for each error, with an annual limit of at least $4 million for all errors reported during the year,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the society may not hold, for any individual, a trust or estate that exceeds $1 million in value, exclusive of the value of the individual's principal residence, and
each director, officer and employee of the society engaged in the trust business of the society must

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: submit a personal information return to the superintendent in the form established by the superintendent, and
notify the superintendent immediately in writing of any material change to the information provided under subparagraph (i).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Exemption — administration of income or disability assistance

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the Province to receive and administer, on a recipient's behalf, income or disability assistance provided to or for the recipient, or
the government of Canada to administer benefits payable under the Canada Pension Plan, the Old Age Security Act (Canada) or another federal Act

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: is exempt from section 70 [unauthorized trust business by corporation prohibited] of the Act.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the Province to receive and administer, on a recipient's behalf, income or disability assistance provided to or for the recipient, or
the government of Canada to administer benefits payable under the Canada Pension Plan, the Old Age Security Act (Canada) or another federal Act

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: is exempt from section 81 [unauthorized deposit business prohibited] of the Act.
An exemption under this section applies only for the purposes of the corporation or person, as the case may be, providing the services described in subsection (1) or (2).

If an enactment requires a corporation to carry on trust business, the corporation is exempt from section 70 [unauthorized trust business by corporation prohibited] of the Act if the corporation complies with the provisions of the enactment that relate to the trust business.
An exemption under this section applies only for the purposes of the corporation carrying on the trust business required under the enactment.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Financial Institutions Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 141, s. 289.]
